answers.answer: Hi,Your boyfriend's weight and dietary habits do put him at higher risk of developing diabetes. Some of his symptoms can be seen in people with diabetes but they are not specific, and it sounds like he is not showing some other signs like fatigue, frequent urination or increased thirst.The only way to know definitely is to have his blood tested, or to  start checking his blood sugars with a meter you can buy at the drug store. Ask him to speak to his doctor about being tested soon.Take care.

question: My boyfriend is 34 years old, about 100 lbs over weight.  He craves sugar, he is always drinking something with tons of sugar in it.  Pepsi, Hawaiian Punch for examples.  I have also noticed at times he smells of maple syrup.  He only drinks water when playing ice hockey, never drinks white milk, always chocolate, does not eat veggies, or fruit.He thinks that I'm nuts, I know I'm not.  I think he maybe diabetic.
title: I need help with something, please!
